title: Consider a single hierarchy of Google Cloud resources. Which of these situations is possible? (Choose 3 responses.)
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: There is no organization node, but there is at least one folder.
There is no organization node, and there are no folders.
There are two or more organization nodes.
There is an organization node, and there is at least one folder.
There is an organization node, and there are no folders.

title: What is the difference between Identity and Access Management (IAM) basic roles and IAM predefined roles?
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: Basic roles only apply to the owner of the Google Cloud project. Predefined roles can be associated with any user.
Basic roles can only be granted to single users. Predefined roles can be associated with a group.
Basic roles only allow viewing, creating, and deleting resources. Predefined roles allow any modification.
Basic roles affect all resources in a Google Cloud project. Predefined roles apply to a specific service in a project.

title: Select the option that displays IAM roles from general to specific.
supportiveInfo: The reason for this question is because such and such

options.title: Custom roles, predefined roles, basic roles
Basic roles, predefined roles, custom roles
Predefined roles, custom roles, basic roles

title: Which statement best describes how Google Cloud resources are associated within the resource hierarchy?
supportiveInfo: All Google Cloud resources are associated with a project.

options.title: All Google Cloud resources are associated with a project.
Google Cloud resources are not associated with the resource hierarchy.
All Google Cloud resources are associated with a folder.
All Google Cloud resources are associated with an organization.

title: How does the resource hierarchy control how IAM policies are inherited?

options.title: IAM policies that are implemented by lower-level policies can override the policies defined at a higher level.
GIAM policies that are implemented higher in the resource hierarchy deny access that is granted by lower-level policies.
IAM policies are only implemented at the project level; they cannot be amended by lower levels of the resource hierarchy.

title: Which way of accessing Google Cloud lets you control services through the code you write?

options.title: APIs
The Cloud SDK and Cloud Shell
The Cloud Console mobile app
The Cloud Console

title: When would you choose to have an organization node? (Select two)

options.title: When you want to organize resources into projects
When you want to create folders
When you want to centrally apply organization-wide policies
There’s no choice; organization nodes are mandatory.

title: Your company has two Google Cloud projects and you want them to share policies. What is the least error-prone way to set this up?

options.title: Define the new shared policy in the organization node.
Place both projects into a folder, and define the policies on that folder.
Duplicate all the policies from one project onto the other.
Create shared resource policies on the common resources that are used in both projects.

title: Which statement describes the correct Cloud Storage use case?

options.title: Cloud Storage provides durable and highly available object storage.
Cloud Storage provides the root file system of a Linux virtual machine.
Cloud Storage provides data warehousing services.
Cloud Storage provides RDBMS (Relational Database Management System) services.

title: How are Firestore and Bigtable alike? (Select two answers.)

options.title: They both offer SQL-like queries.
They are both highly scalable.
They both have a free daily quota.
They are both NoSQL databases.

title: Which SQL database service can scale to petabyte database sizes?

options.title: Firestore
Cloud Spanner
Cloud SQL
Bigtable

title: Your application needs to store data with strong transactional consistency, and you want seamless scaling up. Which storage option is the best choice for your application?

options.title: Cloud SQL
Cloud Spanner
Firestore
Bigtable

title: You manufacture devices with sensors and need to stream huge amounts of data from these devices to a storage option in the cloud. Which storage option is the best choice for your application?

options.title: Cloud SQL
Cloud Spanner
Firestore
Bigtable

title: Why would a customer consider the Coldline Storage class?

options.title: To save money on storing frequently accessed data
To save money on storing infrequently accessed data
To improve security
To use the Coldline Storage API

title: Which statement best describes how VPC routers and firewalls work?

options.title: They are managed by Google in virtual machines and customers cannot modify them.
They are managed by Google as a built-in feature.
They are managed by Google in virtual machines and customers can tune or deactivate them.
Customers provision virtual machines and run their routers and firewalls in them.

title: A Google Cloud customer wants to load-balance traffic among the backend VMs that form part of a multi-tier application. Which load-balancing option should this customer choose?

options.title: The regional internal load balancer
The global TCP proxy
The global HTTP(S) load balancer
The regional load balancer
The global SSL proxy

title: Preemptible VMs can offer advantages over a standard Compute Engine VM. What is a reason customers choose preemptible VMs?
supportiveInfo: The per-hour price of preemptible VMs incorporates a substantial discount.

options.title: To reduce cost
To reduce cost on premium operating systems
To use custom machine types
To improve performance

title: Which interconnect option is a service level agreement (SLA) available for?

options.title: Direct Peering
Dedicated Interconnect
Carrier Peering
Standard Network Tier

title: Which term describes a secure, individual, private cloud-computing model hosted within a public cloud?

options.title: Virtual private cloud (VPC)
Content delivery network (CDN)
Virtual private network (VPN)
Domain name system (DNS)

title: Select the true statement about Google’s VPC networks and subnets.

options.title: Networks are regional, and subnets are zonal.
Networks are global, and subnets are regional.
Networks are global, and subnets are zonal.
Both networks and subnets are global.
